definition: Liu Yu, founder of Song of the Southern dynasties 劉宋|刘宋[Liu2 Song4], broke away from Eastern Jin in 420, reigned as Emperor Wu of Song 宋武帝[Song4 Wu3 di4]
(classical) a type of battle-ax/to kill/to slaughter
surname Liu
abundant
Liu Yu, founder of Southern dynasty Song 劉宋|刘宋, broke away from Eastern Jin in 420

sentences.english: These measures had certain influences on the development of Buddhism in the time to come.
sentences.chinese: 刘裕的这些举措，对此后佛教的发展有一定的影响。

sentences.english: The war against Hou-Qin is one important step of Liu Yu's for replacing East-Jin.
sentences.chinese: 北伐后秦是刘裕完成其代晋事业采取的对外措施之一。

definition: Huan Xuan (369-404), general involved in the break-up of Eastern Jin

Wang Shichong (-621), general of late Sui and opponent of early Tang

old name for Nanjing 南京, esp. during Southern dynasties
Huangfu Song (-195), later Han general and warlord

Sun Ce (175-200), general and major warlord of the Later Han Dynasty
Liu Biao (142-208), warlord
Dong Zhuo (-192), top general of late Han, usurped power in 189, murdered empress dowager and child emperor, killed in 192 by Lü Bu 呂布|吕布

Yuan Shao (153-202), general during late Han, subsequently warlord
Sun Quan (reigned 222-252), southern warlord and king of state of Wu 吳|吴 in the Three Kingdoms period
